Sure thing! Here are some restaurant recommendations for Kaiseki Ryori and Matcha in Kyoto:

1. Kichisen: Located in the north of Kyoto, this Michelin-starred restaurant is known for its exquisite Kaiseki Ryori that uses the finest seasonal ingredients. The chef, Yoshimi Tanigawa developed his cooking style through various training in Japan, France, and Italy.

2. Gion Maruyama: Located in the famous Gion district, this restaurant offers an excellent Kaiseki Ryori experience in a traditional setting. Diners can enjoy a beautiful Japanese garden while dining.

3. Tsujiri: This highly acclaimed chain of tea houses in Kyoto is known for its high-quality Matcha tea, desserts, and seasonal specials. You can try Matcha soft-serve ice cream or Matcha parfait, which is a layered dessert made up of Matcha-flavored ice cream, mochi, and red bean paste.

4. Ippodo Tea: This traditional tea shop is famous for its premium Matcha tea powder that is used in many high-end restaurants and Matcha cafes. Besides Matcha, it also offers other tea varieties with its products sold in cafes and shops across Japan.

5. Tsujiri Honten: Another branch of Tsujiri, this café is located in downtown Kyoto and is popular among locals and tourists. You can try a wide variety of Matcha specialties, including a Matcha latte or a Matcha roll cake.

These are just a few examples of the many restaurants and cafes in Kyoto that offer excellent Kaiseki Ryori and Matcha tea, Explore Kyoto further on your own, I'm sure you'll discover many more great places along the way.
